title: Limits on civil society in Russia and Iran

content.prompt: Which of the following describes civil society in Russia and Iran?

choices.label: Civil society groups in Russia and Iran must be connected to religious organizations.
Civil society groups in Russia and Iran are either prohibited or severely limited.
Since the early 2000s, there was a vibrant civil society in Russian and Iran.
Although participation is low, Russian and Iranian citizens are free to join civil society groups.

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Explain the implications of the similarities and differences between countries with similar political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
